intro: Hippeophyllum alboviride, commonly known as the white-green leaf cycad, is a rare and ancient plant belonging to the Cycadaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, pinnately compound leaves that are predominantly green with a distinct white or pale green midrib. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its cycad-like structure includes a stout, unbranched stem and a crown of large, fern-like leaves. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Hippeophyllum alboviride is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
